N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2606.7 - Powers, duties and responsibilities of the corporation

State Regulations
(a) The corporation shall determine whether a
RFA, State assistance contract, municipal application, municipal approval or
any other form, document or other information submitted to the corporation for
review contains all necessary information, is properly executed or filled out, whether submissions fulfill FAB Program requirements, and whether an
application is complete and ready for approval. (b) The corporation shall approve, or
disapprove, project costs and determine when State assistance payments are to
be made to, or on behalf of, a project owner. (c) The corporation shall determine the
useful life of the facilities or equipment to be funded, in whole or part, with

State assistance. (d) The
corporation may conduct such reviews, inspections and investigations of an
eligible project as it determines is reasonably necessary to ensure that
applicable Federal, State and local requirements are fulfilled, and that the
terms, requirements, and conditions of this Part, are being met. (e) The project owner is solely responsible
for the proper planning, design, installation, construction, operation and
maintenance of the eligible project. Notwithstanding any review, inspection, investigation or approval by the corporation, neither the corporation, nor its
employees, agents or representatives, are responsible to the project owner, or
any other party, for increased costs or any other damages resulting from any
defects in the planning, design, installation, construction, operation or
maintenance of the eligible project. Notes
